trailingComments.value:
*
 * The `DiscussionPage` component displays a whole discussion page, including
 * the discussion list pane, the hero, the posts, and the sidebar.

*
     * The discussion that is being viewed.
     *
     * @type {Discussion}

leadingComments.value:
*
     * The discussion that is being viewed.
     *
     * @type {Discussion}

trailingComments.value:
*
     * The number of the first post that is currently visible in the viewport.
     *
     * @type {Integer}

leadingComments.value:
*
     * The number of the first post that is currently visible in the viewport.
     *
     * @type {Integer}

trailingComments.value: If the discussion list has been loaded, then we'll enable the pane (and
hide it by default). Also, if we've just come from another discussion
page, then we don't want Mithril to redraw the whole page – if it did,
then the pane would redraw which would be slow and would cause problems with
event handlers.

leadingComments.value: If the discussion list has been loaded, then we'll enable the pane (and
hide it by default). Also, if we've just come from another discussion
page, then we don't want Mithril to redraw the whole page – if it did,
then the pane would redraw which would be slow and would cause problems with
event handlers.
If we have routed to the same discussion as we were viewing previously,
cancel the unloading of this controller and instead prompt the post
stream to jump to the new 'near' param.

trailingComments.value: If we are indeed navigating away from this discussion, then disable the
discussion list pane. Also, if we're composing a reply to this
discussion, minimize the composer – unless it's empty, in which case
we'll just close it.

leadingComments.value: If we are indeed navigating away from this discussion, then disable the
discussion list pane. Also, if we're composing a reply to this
discussion, minimize the composer – unless it's empty, in which case
we'll just close it.

trailingComments.value:
*
   * Clear and reload the discussion.

leadingComments.value: We must wrap this in a setTimeout because if we are mounting this
component for the first time on page load, then any calls to m.redraw
will be ineffective and thus any configs (scroll code) will be run
before stuff is drawn to the page.

*
   * Clear and reload the discussion.

trailingComments.value:
*
   * Get the parameters that should be passed in the API request to get the
   * discussion.
   *
   * @return {Object}

leadingComments.value:
*
   * Get the parameters that should be passed in the API request to get the
   * discussion.
   *
   * @return {Object}

trailingComments.value:
*
   * Initialize the component to display the given discussion.
   *
   * @param {Discussion} discussion
When the API responds with a discussion, it will also include a number of
posts. Some of these posts are included because they are on the first
page of posts we want to display (determined by the `near` parameter) –
others may be included because due to other relationships introduced by
extensions. We need to distinguish the two so we don't end up displaying
the wrong posts. We do so by filtering out the posts that don't have
the 'discussion' relationship linked, then sorting and splicing.

leadingComments.value: When the API responds with a discussion, it will also include a number of
posts. Some of these posts are included because they are on the first
page of posts we want to display (determined by the `near` parameter) –
others may be included because due to other relationships introduced by
extensions. We need to distinguish the two so we don't end up displaying
the wrong posts. We do so by filtering out the posts that don't have
the 'discussion' relationship linked, then sorting and splicing.

trailingComments.value: Set up the post stream for this discussion, along with the first page of
posts we want to display. Tell the stream to scroll down and highlight
the specific post that was routed to.

leadingComments.value: Set up the post stream for this discussion, along with the first page of
posts we want to display. Tell the stream to scroll down and highlight
the specific post that was routed to.

*
   * Initialize the component to display the given discussion.
   *
   * @param {Discussion} discussion

trailingComments.value:
*
   * Configure the discussion list pane.
   *
   * @param {DOMElement} element
   * @param {Boolean} isInitialized
   * @param {Object} context
When the mouse enters and leaves the discussions pane, we want to show
and hide the pane respectively. We also create a 10px 'hot edge' on the
left of the screen to activate the pane.

leadingComments.value: When the mouse enters and leaves the discussions pane, we want to show
and hide the pane respectively. We also create a 10px 'hot edge' on the
left of the screen to activate the pane.

trailingComments.value: If the discussion we are viewing is listed in the discussion list, then
we will make sure it is visible in the viewport – if it is not we will
scroll the list down to it.

leadingComments.value: If the discussion we are viewing is listed in the discussion list, then
we will make sure it is visible in the viewport – if it is not we will
scroll the list down to it.

*
   * Configure the discussion list pane.
   *
   * @param {DOMElement} element
   * @param {Boolean} isInitialized
   * @param {Object} context

*
   * Build an item list for the contents of the sidebar.
   *
   * @return {ItemList}

leadingComments.value:
*
   * Build an item list for the contents of the sidebar.
   *
   * @return {ItemList}

trailingComments.value:
*
   * When the posts that are visible in the post stream change (i.e. the user
   * scrolls up or down), then we update the URL and mark the posts as read.
   *
   * @param {Integer} startNumber
   * @param {Integer} endNumber
Construct a URL to this discussion with the updated position, then
replace it into the window's history and our own history stack.

leadingComments.value: Construct a URL to this discussion with the updated position, then
replace it into the window's history and our own history stack.

trailingComments.value: If the user hasn't read past here before, then we'll update their read
state and redraw.

leadingComments.value: If the user hasn't read past here before, then we'll update their read
state and redraw.

*
   * When the posts that are visible in the post stream change (i.e. the user
   * scrolls up or down), then we update the URL and mark the posts as read.
   *
   * @param {Integer} startNumber
   * @param {Integer} endNumber

*
 * The `DiscussionPage` component displays a whole discussion page, including
 * the discussion list pane, the hero, the posts, and the sidebar.

*
 * The `DiscussionPage` component displays a whole discussion page, including
 * the discussion list pane, the hero, the posts, and the sidebar.

comments.value:
*
 * The `DiscussionPage` component displays a whole discussion page, including
 * the discussion list pane, the hero, the posts, and the sidebar.

*
     * The discussion that is being viewed.
     *
     * @type {Discussion}

*
     * The number of the first post that is currently visible in the viewport.
     *
     * @type {Integer}
If the discussion list has been loaded, then we'll enable the pane (and
hide it by default). Also, if we've just come from another discussion
page, then we don't want Mithril to redraw the whole page – if it did,
then the pane would redraw which would be slow and would cause problems with
event handlers.
If we have routed to the same discussion as we were viewing previously,
cancel the unloading of this controller and instead prompt the post
stream to jump to the new 'near' param.
If we are indeed navigating away from this discussion, then disable the
discussion list pane. Also, if we're composing a reply to this
discussion, minimize the composer – unless it's empty, in which case
we'll just close it.

*
   * Clear and reload the discussion.
We must wrap this in a setTimeout because if we are mounting this
component for the first time on page load, then any calls to m.redraw
will be ineffective and thus any configs (scroll code) will be run
before stuff is drawn to the page.

*
   * Get the parameters that should be passed in the API request to get the
   * discussion.
   *
   * @return {Object}

*
   * Initialize the component to display the given discussion.
   *
   * @param {Discussion} discussion
When the API responds with a discussion, it will also include a number of
posts. Some of these posts are included because they are on the first
page of posts we want to display (determined by the `near` parameter) –
others may be included because due to other relationships introduced by
extensions. We need to distinguish the two so we don't end up displaying
the wrong posts. We do so by filtering out the posts that don't have
the 'discussion' relationship linked, then sorting and splicing.
Set up the post stream for this discussion, along with the first page of
posts we want to display. Tell the stream to scroll down and highlight
the specific post that was routed to.

*
   * Configure the discussion list pane.
   *
   * @param {DOMElement} element
   * @param {Boolean} isInitialized
   * @param {Object} context
When the mouse enters and leaves the discussions pane, we want to show
and hide the pane respectively. We also create a 10px 'hot edge' on the
left of the screen to activate the pane.
If the discussion we are viewing is listed in the discussion list, then
we will make sure it is visible in the viewport – if it is not we will
scroll the list down to it.

*
   * Build an item list for the contents of the sidebar.
   *
   * @return {ItemList}

*
   * When the posts that are visible in the post stream change (i.e. the user
   * scrolls up or down), then we update the URL and mark the posts as read.
   *
   * @param {Integer} startNumber
   * @param {Integer} endNumber
Construct a URL to this discussion with the updated position, then
replace it into the window's history and our own history stack.
If the user hasn't read past here before, then we'll update their read
state and redraw.
